paragraphs.content: A for loop is used to repeateadly execute a block of code (loop through) a specified amount of times. This is used when the programmer knows how many times to execute the block of code in order to achieve the correct result.

paragraphs.subheading: How to create a for loop
paragraphs.content: Look at the example below. Within the brackets after 'for', you can see three statements, all of which are seperated with a semi-colon.
The first statement 'int i = 0;' creates the variable that will indicate which iteration the loop is on. 'i' stands for index and commonly used in loops in Java.

images.caption: 'The first statement of a for loop'

trueFalseQuiz.question: True or false: The first statements variable must be defined as 'i'.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! It does not have to be defined as 'i' however, this is a common practise in Java.
trueFalseQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The first statements variable does not have to be defined as 'i' however, this is a common practise in Java.

paragraphs.content: The second statement 'i < 10;' specifies the period for the loop to run. If this statement is true, the loop continues. In this case, the loop ends when the index 'i' is bigger than 10.

images.caption: 'The second statement of a for loop'

openChoiceQuiz.question: Can any opeartor be used within the second statement?
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct, great work! Any operator covered in the 'operators' topic can be used to define the statement.
openChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Sorry, but that's the wrong answer! The correct answer is yes! Any operator covered in the 'operators' topic can be used to define the statement.

paragraphs.content: The third statement 'i++' specifies how much to increment the index by on each iteration of the loop. In this case, it increments by 1 on each loop.

images.caption: 'The third statement of a for loop'

multipleChoiceQuiz.question: Which of the following would not be allowed as a third statement in Java?
multipleChoiceQuiz.feedbackRight: Correct! All of the options are allowed as a third statement in Java.
multipleChoiceQuiz.feedbackWrong: Wrong! The correct answer is 'None of the above' as all of the options can be used as a third statement.
